Job Title: Operations Manager, Deer Valley

Location: Utah, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Customer Service, General Business, Management

Description:
POSITION DESCRIPTION
The Operations Manager is responsible for the overall operation of the destination. The Operations Manager plays an integral role in creating an exceptional service experience for Exclusive Resorts members and performs concierge duties. Some of the key areas the Operations Manager is responsible for are overall service of, housekeeping and property management, member satisfaction, vendor relations and supervision, inventories, monthly reports, and overall condition and upkeep of the destination.
ESSENTIAL ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Concierge Ensures service standards are met and/or exceeded. Performs concierge duties. Is knowledgeable and is able to perform duties without reluctance or indecision. Determines needs and scheduling for residence deep cleans; manages the deep clean projects on site. Responds to elevated communications from members and the corporate office within 24 hours of delivery. Responds to elevated in-house member requests within two hours. Provides service to members related to their use of the destination and enjoyment of surrounding attractions while maintaining a professional appearance and courteous demeanor. Oversees special and unique requests from members while in destination. Makes determination of outcome of the request. Prepares and processes house bills, ensuring compliance according to Standard Operating Procedures. Responsible for petty cash.Oversees member grocery requests, ensuring compliance with Standard Operating Procedures. Remains accessible for member needs at all times during the memberâ€™s stay in the destination. 
Housekeeping Oversees and manages daily housekeeping and cleaning services that are provided by a housekeeping vendor. Ensures all housekeeping standards are met and maintained. Conducts weekly walkthroughs of homes with Housekeeping vendor, ensuring that all items noted are followed up on and completed. 
Property Management Oversees and manages property management vendor; ensures all physical aspects of the destination are working at all times. Conducts weekly walkthroughs of homes with Property Maintenance vendor. Executes maintenance of destination by directing property management vendor.  General ResponsiblitiesEvaluates and fixes any concerns with members, housekeeping and property maintenance in the destination while reporting them to the Regional Manager. Provides event management and coordination for member requested special events or corporate special events (arrangement of private parties etc.). Conducts tours of destination for prospective members. Manages outstanding projects as determined by the Regional Manager. Interviews, hires, and certifies training and development of concierge, housekeeping, and maintenance according to Exclusive Resorts standards. Performs performance evaluations and recertification training for concierge, housekeeping, and maintenance. Reports all financial expenditures related to the destination. Communicates with Regional Manager regarding any changes within the destination for purposes of member and internal communication as well as performing quarterly audits of all member confirmations, concierge welcome emails, The Source, and in-residence materials. Maintains the consumables closet and ensures all supplies are up to quantity standards. Provides corporate office with the inventory of consumables on regular basis, Obtains project proposals from third-party vendors to submit for approval. Manages and inspects projects conducted within the destination. Works in conjunction with Corporate Office on implementation of new procedures; responsible for training on site staff on any new procedures. Ensures all grooming standards are met for onsite staff, according to Exclusive Resorts standards. Maintains a list of preferred vendors. Negotiates third-party service contracts for destination. Maintains accurate inventory of all Operating Supplies & Equipment within the destination and provide accurate information to Regional Manager for replenishment. Prepares and submits billing invoices according to Exclusive Resorts standards.  Supervisory Responsibilities Supervises housekeeping, maintenance, and third-party vendors.

Experience Level (if available): Associate
